body:
# 2024-03-18

Addressing the question [what connections are there between the Zettelkasten
system, creative ideation and network graphs?](../../it61). Trying to think
about how zk and graphs are complex systems, and how creative ideation is the
result of those systems. How does that happen? That [consciousness occurs when
colonies of cells are large enough in number and connections](../../k8pg) is an
interesting angle, but in the case of zk, the notes aren't 'interacting' with
themselves per se. Rather, it is the interaction within the mind, of the
information they hold, that somehow comes together to create an idea.

Idea's are generated from borrowing parts of pre-existing information.
rawContent:
---
title: 2024-03-18
date: 2024-03-18 14:39
tags: [p/thesis]
---

# 2024-03-18

Addressing the question [what connections are there between the Zettelkasten
system, creative ideation and network graphs?](../../it61). Trying to think
about how zk and graphs are complex systems, and how creative ideation is the
result of those systems. How does that happen? That [consciousness occurs when
colonies of cells are large enough in number and connections](../../k8pg) is an
interesting angle, but in the case of zk, the notes aren't 'interacting' with
themselves per se. Rather, it is the interaction within the mind, of the
information they hold, that somehow comes together to create an idea.

Idea's are generated from borrowing parts of pre-existing information.

body:
# 2024-03-28

processing
[The Whole Is Always Smaller Than Its Parts - a Digital Test of Gabriel Tardes Monads](../../r/szz2).
It makes good points in line with how I'm thinking about
[how does the Zettelkasten system promote creative thinking?](../../t5v3) for my
[ctech masters thesis](../../i/ip4r).

The 1-LS theory helps in describing that there is effectively no emergent
structure that exists consistently. Rather 'the whole' is an entity which
_borrows_ from any and all other entities within the system.

This leads me to think that zettelkasten can support ideation because it is a
system of individual entities (notes) that have overlapping associations
(links), and by moving within the data set we are experiencing 'the whole' from
different view points at any one time. This leads us to arrive at a particular
view point, built from the shared attributes of other notes (links and content)
that create a novel idea by means of combining those shared attributes.

So [Zettelkasten promotes ideation due to inter-note linking](../../mv04) as
this allows the individual entities to _lend parts of themselves_ to the whole.

ML can therefore aid in uncovering the shared attributes between notes that we
didn't pick up on ourselves. Furthermore, it can be _designed in a way that is
novel and inspiring to work with_.

Network graphs therefore, aid in the identification of shared attributes and can
be used to move through the whole in a way that aids in making broad shifts in
viewpoint (many hops in one movement, as compared to singular hops from note to
note)
rawContent:
---
title: 2024-03-28
date: 2024-03-28 15:40
tags: [p/thesis]

# 2024-03-28

processing
[The Whole Is Always Smaller Than Its Parts - a Digital Test of Gabriel Tardes Monads](../../r/szz2).
It makes good points in line with how I'm thinking about
[how does the Zettelkasten system promote creative thinking?](../../t5v3) for my
[ctech masters thesis](../../i/ip4r).

The 1-LS theory helps in describing that there is effectively no emergent
structure that exists consistently. Rather 'the whole' is an entity which
_borrows_ from any and all other entities within the system.

This leads me to think that zettelkasten can support ideation because it is a
system of individual entities (notes) that have overlapping associations
(links), and by moving within the data set we are experiencing 'the whole' from
different view points at any one time. This leads us to arrive at a particular
view point, built from the shared attributes of other notes (links and content)
that create a novel idea by means of combining those shared attributes.

So [Zettelkasten promotes ideation due to inter-note linking](../../mv04) as
this allows the individual entities to _lend parts of themselves_ to the whole.

ML can therefore aid in uncovering the shared attributes between notes that we

Network graphs therefore, aid in the identification of shared attributes and can
be used to move through the whole in a way that aids in making broad shifts in
viewpoint (many hops in one movement, as compared to singular hops from note to
note)

body:
# 2024-04-02

The theories of [Connectionism](../../g/0d9n) (via
[Connectionism and Cognitive Architecture - A critical analysis](../../r/61ts))
and the 1-LS approach to interpreting networked data systems
([The Whole Is Always Smaller Than Its Parts - a Digital Test of Gabriel Tardes Monads](../../r/szz2)),
are seeming to fit my concept and approach to the
[ctech masters thesis](../../i/ip4r).

Connectionism will help to explain:

- how creative ideas can arise from zettelkasten (both are systems of data
  being input and output from nodes). Still to be explored is at what moment
  that happens in Zk: It happens when spawning a new note as well as when
  following a link to an established note. When travelling this way, the reader
  brings new context to the destination note, which is then infused with the
  content of that destination note and can lead to the unexpected discovery of
  'shared associations' (a term from Latour, the whole is always smaller... paper)
rawContent:
---
title: 2024-04-02
date: 2024-04-02 12:06
tags: [p/thesis]
---

# 2024-04-02

The theories of [Connectionism](../../g/0d9n) (via
[Connectionism and Cognitive Architecture - A critical analysis](../../r/61ts))
and the 1-LS approach to interpreting networked data systems
([The Whole Is Always Smaller Than Its Parts - a Digital Test of Gabriel Tardes Monads](../../r/szz2)),
are seeming to fit my concept and approach to the
[ctech masters thesis](../../i/ip4r).

Connectionism will help to explain:

- how creative ideas can arise from zettelkasten (both are systems of data
  being input and output from nodes). Still to be explored is at what moment
  that happens in Zk: It happens when spawning a new note as well as when
  following a link to an established note. When travelling this way, the reader
  brings new context to the destination note, which is then infused with the
  content of that destination note and can lead to the unexpected discovery of
  'shared associations' (a term from Latour, the whole is always smaller... paper)
